Fig. 1: Different matrix orderings for the same matrix data.
Table 1: Overview over all tested feature descriptors (FDs). FD names are hyperlinks to access an interactive FD profile page with e.g., a distance-to-noise and a distance-to-base ranking.

Fig. 3: FD evaluation methodology and main concepts: After a selection of candidate FDs and the generation of a pattern retrieval benchmark dataset for matrices, we evaluated all FDs with respect to four distinct evaluation criteria (C1-C4).
Fig. 4: Examples of matrices as used in benchmark. Benchmark data set can be downloaded at our M AGNOSTICS website.
Fig. 5: Distances between two selected feature vectors (T HUMBNAIL and C OMPACTNESS) of different pattern variations.
Fig. 7: Pattern Discrimination (C4): High mean values indicate high distances between feature vectors for the individual patterns (CI=95%).
Fig. 6: Relations between degeneration levels and mean distance (red) to base patterns.

Fig. 9: Result table showing all values. Colors correspond to criteria (blue=C1 (response), red=C2 (variability), brown=C3 (sensitivity)). Black dots in each colored rectangle indicate our subjective ranking; 3 dots represent high ranks, 0 dots indicate low ranks.

Fig. 8: Analysis result overview for all FD and patterns: (a) C1: numbers present the F2-score; higher scores (darker) indicate better response to the pattern, (b) C2: high values (darker) indicate higher variability between patterns, (c) C3: low values (darker) indicate lower sensitivity.

Fig. 9: Result table showing all values. Colors correspond to criteria (blue=C1 (response), red=C2 (variability), brown=C3 (sensitivity)). Black dots in each colored rectangle indicate our subjective ranking; 3 dots represent high ranks, 0 dots indicate low ranks.

Fig. 10: Query-By-Sketch interface for exploring large collections of matrix plots. The user can sketch in the canvas (1) an approximated matrix pattern and retrieve a ranked result list (2) according to a selected M AGNOSTICS FD (3).
